intro: Noronhia luteola, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette, while its stems are often hairy. Noronhia luteola is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
